intro: Porana velutina, commonly known as the velvet leaf porana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, round berries. Porana velutina is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and thickets.
